snippet: Lisa Martino is one of 95 fellows poised to become New York City’s newest teachers, as part of Mayor Bill de Blasio’s universal prekindergarten program.
abstract: Rachel L Swarns The Working Life column discusses army of new teachers like Lisa Martino who will lead classrooms across New York City as Mayor Bill de Blasio rolls out first phase of his universal prekindergarten program; Martino is one of 95 scholars enrolled in city-funded fellowship program run by New York Early Childhood Professional Development Institute.
lead_paragraph: Lisa Martino is one of 95 fellows poised to become New York City’s newest teachers, as part of Mayor Bill de Blasio’s universal prekindergarten program.

headline.main: A Parent Answering a Call for Pre-K Teachers Goes Back to Work (and School)
headline.print_headline: A Parent Answering a Call for Pre-K Teachers Goes Back to Work (and School)

keywords.value: New York Early Childhood Professional Development Institute
keywords.name: organizations
